An unhandled exception occurs during AC testing with the SampleFileTransferAC Java sample. Nevertheless the test is completed successfully.

This is the output:

Connecting to AC..
Connected to localhost at port number 10006
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.agent.internal.AgentImpl.startMonitoring(AgentImpl.java:481)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.agent.internal.AgentImpl.startMonitoring(AgentImpl.java:506)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.FileTransferManagerImpl.createFileDataConnection(FileTransferManagerImpl.java:41)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.client.core.internal.AgentController.getFileTransferManager(AgentController.java:1302)
	at org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution.samples.SampleFileTransferAC.main(SampleFileTransferAC.java:97)
All the above file operations completed successfuly

End of output.

To reproduce the test, it is necessary:
1) prepare five files at the C:\. The files are:
   c:\empty.foo - zero length file
   c:\big_simple.txt - any text file preferable of 132096 bytes length
   c:\small.txt - any small text file
   c:\temp\test.zip - any binary file
   c:\temp\test2.zip - any binary file
2) Install, configure, and run AC
3) Run /org.eclipse.tptp.platform.execution/src/org/eclipse/tptp/platform/execution/samples/SampleFileTransferAC.java as Java Application.

The result of the test is:
1) empty.foo is copied to put_dupe5.foo
2) big_simple.txt is copied to big_dupe1.txt and big_dupe2.txt
3) small.txt is copied to put_dupe4.txt
4) temp\test.zip is copied to put_dupe3.zip
5) temp\test2.zip is deleted

Such behavior exists both on Windows and Linux.
This is for the TPTP-4.4.0-200705080100B build.
The bug is disappeared in the TPTP-4.4.0.1-200707090100 build.
